question: The "Yangtze River", the longest river in Asia, is located in which nation?
explanation: The Yangtze River of China is the longest river in Asia. It is the third-longest river in the world and also the longest river in the world to flow entirely within one country. It is the sixth-largest river by discharge volume in the world. This river houses the "Three Gorges Dam", the largest hydro-electric power station in the world. This river originates from Jari Hills of Tanggula Mountains and drains its water to the East China Sea.
